greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle T(n,k) read by rows, where T(n,k) = number of times the permanent of a real singular n X n (0,1)-matrix takes the value k, for n >= 2, 0 <= k <= n!.
reference: Seok-Zun Song et al., Extremes of permanents of (0,1)-matrices, Linear Algebra and its Applications 373, (2003), pp. 197-210.
xref: T(n, 0)=A088672(n). The n-th row of the table contains A089476(n) nonzero entries. Cf. A089479 occurrence counts for permanents of all (0, 1)-matrices.
results.author: _Hugo Pfoertner_, Nov 09 2003
